attributes.description:
Controls the horizontal spacing between the checkbox box (the square input element) and the label text. This creates visual separation so users can easily distinguish between the clickable checkbox and its descriptive text.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-gap

Controls the size of the checkbox label text (the descriptive text that appears next to the checkbox). This text explains what the checkbox option represents, such as 'I agree to terms' or 'Subscribe to newsletter'.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-caption-font-size

Sets the font family (typeface) for the checkbox label text. This determines the visual style of the text that describes what the checkbox option represents.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-caption-font-family

Controls the thickness/boldness of the checkbox label text. Acceptable values: normal, bold, 100-900. This affects how prominent the descriptive text appears next to the checkbox.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-caption-font-weight

Controls the vertical spacing between lines of text in the checkbox label. This is important when the label text wraps to multiple lines, ensuring proper readability.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-caption-line-height

Controls the horizontal spacing between individual characters in the checkbox label text. Positive values spread letters apart, negative values bring them closer together.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-caption-letter-spacing

Controls the width and height of the checkbox box (the square input element that users click to check/uncheck). This determines how large the actual checkbox appears visually. Acceptable units: px, em, rem.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-size

Controls the size of the checkmark icon (the ✓ symbol) that appears inside the checkbox when it's checked. This icon is typically smaller than the checkbox box itself to fit nicely inside. Acceptable units: px, em, rem.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-icon-size

Sets the color of the checkmark icon (the ✓ symbol) that appears inside the checkbox when it's checked. This is typically a contrasting color to ensure the checkmark is clearly visible against the checkbox background.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-icon-color

Sets the background color of the checkbox box (the square input element). When transparent, only the border is visible. When filled with a color, the checkbox appears solid. This affects the visual appearance of the unchecked state.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-background

Controls the thickness of the border around the checkbox box (the square input element). This creates the outline that defines the checkbox shape and makes it visible to users.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-border-width

Sets the color of the border around the checkbox box (the square input element). This determines the color of the outline that defines the checkbox shape in its default/unchecked state.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-border-color

Controls the corner rounding of the checkbox box (the square input element). Small values create slightly rounded corners, while larger values make the checkbox more rounded or even circular.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-border-radius

Controls the size of the invisible clickable area around the checkbox (the state layer). This area is larger than the visible checkbox box, making it easier for users to click and interact with the checkbox. Acceptable units: px, em, rem.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-state-layer-size

Sets the color of the state layer that appears when users hover, focus, or interact with the checkbox. This creates visual feedback to show that the checkbox is interactive and responsive to user actions.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-state-layer-color

Controls the transparency of the state layer that appears during user interactions (hover, focus, active). When set to 0, the state layer is invisible. Higher values make the interaction feedback more visible.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-state-layer-opacity

Controls the opacity of the state layer when users hover their mouse over the checkbox. This creates a subtle visual feedback effect to indicate that the checkbox is interactive and ready to be clicked.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-state-layer-opacity (hover state)

Controls the opacity of the state layer when the checkbox receives keyboard focus (when users navigate to it using Tab key). This provides visual feedback for keyboard navigation accessibility.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-state-layer-opacity (focus state)

Controls the opacity of the state layer when users are actively clicking/pressing the checkbox. This provides immediate visual feedback during the click interaction.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-state-layer-opacity (active state)

Sets the color of the state layer when the checkbox is checked. This creates a colored background effect to emphasize the selected/checked state of the checkbox.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-state-layer-color (checked state)

Sets the background color of the checkbox box when it's checked. This fills the checkbox with a color to visually indicate that the option has been selected.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-background (checked state)

Sets the border color of the checkbox box when it's checked. This changes the outline color to match the checked state, creating a cohesive visual appearance.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-border-color (checked state)

Sets the color of the checkmark icon (✓) when the checkbox is checked. This ensures the checkmark is clearly visible against the colored background of the checked checkbox.
CSS variable: --wm-checkbox-icon-color (checked state)
